definitions.definition: To make slightly wet or soiled by spattering or sprinkling a liquid (such as water , mud , or paint ) on it; to bedabble .
To cause splashing by moving a body part like a bill or limb in soft mud, water, etc., often playfully ; to play in shallow water; to paddle .
examples: The children sat on the dock and dabbled their feet in the water.

definitions.definition: To feed without diving , by submerging the head and neck underwater to seek food, often also tipping up the tail straight upwards above the water.
To participate or have an interest in an activity in a casual or superficial way.
examples: She’s an actress by trade, but has been known to dabble in poetry.

definitions.definition: To interfere or meddle in; to tamper with.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To make slightly wet or soiled by spattering or sprinkling a liquid (such as water , mud , or paint ) on it; to bedabble . [from late 16th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To cause splashing by moving a body part like a bill or limb in soft mud, water, etc., often playfully ; to play in shallow water; to paddle .
( intransitive , of waterfowl ) To feed without diving , by submerging the head and neck underwater to seek food, often also tipping up the tail straight upwards above the water.
( intransitive , figuratively ) To participate or have an interest in an activity in a casual or superficial way.
( intransitive , obsolete ) To interfere or meddle in; to tamper with.
